name: Singapore Flying College Pte Ltd
about: Singapore Flying College Pte Ltd, established in 1988 as a wholly-owned subsidiary of Singapore Airlines Ltd, is a premier flight training institution. With the motto "Bene Docere" or "Teaching it Right," the college is committed to delivering the highest quality of training to produce world-class pilots. Approved by the Civil Aviation Authority of Singapore (CAAS) and the Civil Aviation Safety Authority (CASA), SFC offers various training programs, including the Multi-Crew Pilot Licence (MPL) and Commercial Pilot Licence (CPL). The college operates training facilities at the SIA Training Centre in Singapore and Jandakot Airport in Perth, Western Australia. With a fleet of Cessna 172s, Piper PA-44 Seminoles, and advanced simulators, SFC focuses on safety, leadership, and teamwork to develop airline-ready pilots. Over 5,000 miles away, SFC has trained more than 2,000 pilots to fly for some of the worldâ€™s best airlines.
